People respond badly when I ask this question, but I'll ask it to you: what are you worried will break? Test that thing.

If you think you might use the JavaMail libraries incorrectly, then I suggest that you do the following, which is a variation on the Golden Master technique.

1. Write a small program that sends a simple message to a group of recipients.
2. Test it by hand.
3. Look at the low-level JavaMail settings you are using to make it work.
4. Create a class (or a Map) that represents the JavaMail settings. This is the Golden Master.
5. Use the Golden Master data to verify that you can build the parameter list correctly.
6. Decouple building the JavaMail parameter object from using JavaMail to consume it.
7. Test the first; don't test the second.

Take care.
